title: Players must adapt tackle technique - to ignore new laws is unbelievably naive
text:
Rugby is on a knife edge around the high tackle laws. I think that World Rugby is doing the right thing by trying to protect players but to enforce change you need sacrificial lambs.

Unfortunately for Argentina that was Tomas Lavanini against England on Saturday. I do not think anyone really debates what the outcome was going to be once his shoulder made contact with Owen Farrell’s jaw. Just a few years ago, he would probably have faced no consequences if the referee had missed it in real time. Even then it might have been just a penalty.

Not any more. Now it is black and white. There is no middle ground if you get it wrong. The fact is the law has been brought in and players simply have to adapt...
description: Rugby is on a knife edge around the high tackle laws.
